lexUnit.name: shiny.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: reflecting light because very smooth, clean, or polished.

sentence.text: The bread , when it came , was stale , the cheese hard and shiny , and the coffee had only one point in its favour .
To her amazement it was a shiny red paperback called How To Succeed In Business .

His bald head was shiny ; his black shoes were shiny ; and his lecture was very shiny indeed .
His grey hair was shiny with rain .
It just looks like pink shiny plastic .

She looked ashen , her skin shiny with sweat .
Her slender body was untidily bundled up in a big leathery jacket and she was wearing long , shiny red boots .

Trilobal : lightweight nylon with a shiny finish .

Trilobal : Very lightweight nylon with a shiny finish .

A plant of noble proportions producing numerous stems each consisting of a large shiny green leaf and a leafy bract from which a spike of soft blue flowers emerges .

Who are these smart types in suits from Next and nice shiny shoes from Freeman Hardy Willis ?

Madge came to the door in a bedraggled dressing-gown , her hair twisted up in curl papers , her face shiny with cold cream .
There were waves of red faces , smiling and shiny in the lamplight , their mouths open as the men roared and sang .
